citation.article-title: Nevskia terrae sp. nov., isolated from soil
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Nevskia terrae sp. nov.
Nevskia terrae (ter′rae. L. gen. n. terrae of the soil).
Cells are strictly aerobic, Gram-negative rods (0.4–0.6 µm in width and 1.0–2.5 µm in length).
Motile with 1–3 subpolar flagella.
Catalase-positive and oxidase-negative.
Grows on R2A agar, but not NA, TSA or MacConkey agar.
Grows very slowly and takes >1 week for colonies to fully develop.
Colonies are ivory, circular and convex with clear margins after 8 days.
Grows at 15–35 °C (optimum 28–30 °C) and at pH 5–7 (optimum pH 6–7).
Does not grow with >1 % NaCl.
Hydrolyses Tween 80, but not casein, chitin, CM-cellulose, DNA, hypoxanthine, pectin, starch, tyrosine or xanthine.

Utilizes l-arabinose, rhamnose, sorbitol, N-acetylglucosamine, melibiose, l-fucose, gluconate, inositol, d-mannitol, 3-hydroxybutyric acid, acetate, citrate, histidine, lactate, malate, proline and propionate as sole carbon and energy sources, but does not utilize d-ribose, d-glucose, d-mannose, maltose, sucrose, glycogen, 5-ketogluconate, salicin, 2-ketogluconate, adipate, itaconate, malonate or phenylacetate.

With API ZYM, positive for esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase, acid phosphatase and naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, but negative for alkaline phosphatase, lipase (C14), cystine arylamidase, trypsin, α-chymotrypsin, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, α-mannosidase and α-fucosidase.
Voges–Proskauer test is negative.
With API 20 E, negative for H2S production, citrate utilization and acid production from d-glucose, d-mannitol, d-sorbitol, l-rhamnose, inositol, sucrose, melibiose, amygdalin and l-arabinose.
With API 20 NE, negative for nitrate reduction, indole production, glucose fermentation, arginine dihydrolase, urease and aesculin hydrolysis.
The major fatty acids (>10 %) are C18 : 1ω7c and C16 : 0.
Ubiquinone-8 is the predominant quinone.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 67.3 mol%.
The type strain, KIS13-15T ( = KACC 12736T = JCM 15425T), was isolated from soil of Baekryoung Island, Republic of Korea.
